results.title: Classroom organisation (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Drake Educational Associates and Ian Lewis
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mathematics in the Infant/First School”.
The point is made that there is no one way to organise a lesson and the teacher in this tape doesn’t always organise her work in the way shown. However viewers will see the basis of her planning and the thought which has gone into her planning of the mathematics class

results.title: Division (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mathematics in the Infant/First School”.
The partitive and measure aspects of division are introduced when a group of children discuss two sharing situations and begin to make a wall chart. The program changes direction near the end to show children applying the four operations they have considered, to find as many ways of writing “6” as they can discover.

results.title: Multiplication (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mathematics in the Infant/First School”.
This program introduces the ‘sets of’, approach to multiplication and the meaning of the multiplication symbol is also considered. Children discussing a dressing-up situation with their teacher use Cartesian cross products to complete the work on multiplication

results.title: Addition and subtraction (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mathematics in the Infant/First School”.
A teaching situation is presented showing children using apparatus to partition a set of seven objects and how their findings are recorded on a wall chart. Shows how to read a mathematical sentence

results.title: Inventing number (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mathematics in the Infant/First School”.
Number is defined as a property of a set and the program shows how children are encouraged to ‘invent number’ by a skilful teacher. Also shows how each discovery is consolidated by playing games

results.title: Sorting (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mathematics in the Infant/First School”.
Sets out the basic principles behind the course and presents the fundamentals of set theory. It progresses from a discussion of sorting objects to matching elements from one set with those of another to the concept of mathematical patterns

results.title: Psychological differences between the sexes
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Marriage and the Family Living”.
Dramatises the way in which a young girl and boy react diversely to similar situations exemplifying some typical psychological differences between the sexes. Emphasizes the girls indirect, subjective approach as opposed to the boys direct objective approach. In marriage these differences can cause misunderstandings.
